Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact my area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

ALLEGATION:
Facility failed to obtain proper criminal history background check as required for
Staff 2.
INVESTIGATION:
An onsite visit to the facility was not completed due to the nature of the compliant and
approved by the area manager.
I received and reviewed emails from DCWL Consultant on May 12, 2021. DCWL
Consultant received an email from DCWL Analyst on May 12, 2021. The email stated
child caring institutions (CCIs) cannot hire without receipt of the CWL-1326 Licensing
Record Clearance Request Child Caring Institutions Staff form. The CWL-1326 form
documents that state based clearances have been completed and that DCWL has
made the request to corresponding states for abuse/neglect and that DCWL has made
a request for criminal history in the Intellicorp system. The email stated those two things
require that the CCI provide DCWL General Office Assistant with the necessary
releases to make these requests. DCWL General Office Assistant was completing
2

follow up on a new hire tracking spreadsheet when she was informed by Mott Children’s
Residence that they already hired Staff 2, although she had not released the CWL-1326
form back to them.
I interviewed DCWL Analyst via telephone on May 12, 2021. She confirmed what was
stated in the email she sent to DCWL Consultant on May 12, 2021. DCWL Analyst
stated Mott Children’s Residence hired Staff 2 prior to receiving the CWL-1326 form
from DCWL. She reported the out-of-state child abuse and neglect clearance request
was not made to the corresponding states because Mott Children’s Residence did not
return the clearance authorization forms with Staff 2’s signature to DCWL so that the
requests could be made. She reported DCWL General Office Assistant would have any
correspondence that she had with Mott Children’s Residence regarding the clearance
forms.
I interviewed the Director of Human Resources and Agency Operations via telephone
on May 13, 2021. She stated she believes Staff 1 submitted all of the required
documents to DCWL to have the out-of-state clearances completed, however, DCWL
had not returned the CWL-1326 form back to Staff 1.
I received and reviewed emails from DCWL General Office Assistant on May 13, 2021.
She emailed Staff 1 on March 2, 2021 regarding the need for Staff 2 to sign
authorization forms to request child abuse and neglect clearances from Colorado and
Arkansas. DCWL General Office Assistant emailed Staff 1 on May 11, 2021 asking if
they still intended to hire Staff 2 as DCWL had some outstanding out-of-state central
registry clearance checks. Staff 1 responded that Staff 2 had been hired and she
attached the results from the Arkansas central registry. Staff 1 indicated that she had
not received the CWL-1326 for Staff 2 from DCWL.
I received and reviewed emails from the Director of Human Resources and Agency
Operations on May 13, 2021. She stated Staff 2 started his employment on March 21,
2021 and was terminated on May 12, 2021 for unrelated reasons. She attached
documents pertaining to Staff 2’s written statement regarding his offense in Colorado,
the written evaluation of the offense, the CWL-1326 which was forwarded to DCWL on
February 26, 2021, his Michigan central registry results, his criminal history results, his
Michigan public sex offender registry results, his Dru Sjodin national sex offender
results, his American Checked nationwide criminal background results, the Colorado
central registry request which was forwarded with payment on March 5, 2021, the
Arkansas central registry request which was forwarded March 1, 2021 and the results
which were received on March 1, 2021.
The Director of Human Resources and Agency Operations sent a second email to me
on May 13, 2021. The correspondence between Staff 1 and DCWL General Office
Assistant was attached to the email. The Director of Human Resources and Agency
Operations stated after reading through documents, she sees the step that was missed.
She stated Staff 1 received the forms to send to the two states, she received the
required signatures and sent them but failed to send a copy back to DCWL which would
3

have prompted them to process the CWL-1326 and forward it back. She reported
moving forward, Staff 1 understands this process now. She stated she had Staff 1
complete an internal audit and she was able to confirm that they do have the CWL-
1326's back from DCWL for all other employees at the agency.
I completed the pre-exit conference of preliminary findings with Director of Human
Resources and Agency Operations via telephone on June 8, 2021. I explained the
process on how the clearances have to be completed for new hires. The Director of
Human Resources and Agency Operations stated Mott Children’s Residence complete
criminal history clearances and child abuse and neglect clearances in addition to the
clearances that DCWL completes.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall not
permit a child caring institution staff member to begin
working unless all of the following has been completed
using the forms, and in the manner, prescribed by the
department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R
400.4113(f), including a fingerprint based check of national
crime information databases, unless an alternative criminal
history check has been approved by the federal
government.
(b) A check of Michigan's child abuse and neglect
central registry or Canadian provincial agency as
referenced in R 400.4113(i). (c) A check of other states'
child abuse registry where the person has lived in within
the preceding five years.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as they failed to obtain
the proper criminal history checks as prescribed by the
department.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4
